text: The second election to Lothian Regional Council was held on 2 May 1978 and saw Labour gaining a majority of the Council's 49 seats amidst a Labour surge across Scotland. Stephen Maxwell, the SNP's Vice-Chairman, was a prominent victim of the Labour gains, losing his seat of Slateford/Hailes.p.1 ==Aggregate results== ==Ward results== ==References== Category:1978 Scottish local elections 1978
title: 1978 Lothian Regional Council election
